title: Ticket #2450: schedd fails to parse its transaction log
description:
A schedd in the glidein factory at UCSD failed to restart after a power outage. It failed with the following exception: 

   ERROR "Error: bad record with op=103 in corrupt logfile" at line 1060 in file /home/condor/execute/dir_22626/userdir/src/condor_utils/classad_log.cpp

Note the complete lack of helpful information about where in the transaction log this error was encountered.

It turned out that there were numerous entries in the transaction log of the following form, where XXXX is replaced by random garbage characters: 

   103 541891.0 HoldReason "CREAM error: CREAM_Job_Register Error: XXXXodName=[jobRegister] ErrorCode=[0] Description=[The CREAM service cannot accept jobs at the moment] FaultCause=[Submissions are disabled!] Timestamp=[Wed 07 Sep 2011 17:54:52]"

Removing the garbage characters made the schedd happy.
remarks:
2011-Sep-12 13:37:10 by danb:
The problem is caused by ascii 0xFF characters. These are treated as an error by the log reading code in LogRecord::readline(), because they happen to match the value of (char)EOF: 

        buf[i] = fgetc( fp );
        if( buf[i] == EOF && !feof( fp ) ) {
            free( buf );
            return( -1 );
        }

But these characters are not forbidden by the log writing code, so it is possible to write a record that is not accepted on read-back. This code that treats EOF as an error dates back to at least 6.4.0 if not earlier.

This failure to distinguish between (char)0xFF and EOF is a bug. I therefore propose fixing the log reader rather than forbidding the writing of 0xFF characters.

It is a shame that the quill log reader is implemented completely separately, duplicating much code. It happens that while fixing a different sort of problem, that code was fixed to distinguish between (char)0xFF and EOF in [17674].

2011-Sep-12 20:56:21 by danb:
Note: some of the commits associated with this ticket are for 7.7.2. The commits that went into 7.6.4 are [27176] and [27182].
